answers.author: Amanda Dodge
answers.text:
Hi Thomas,
I have been able to find a few resources that could be useful for you. 
To begin, there was a question posted very recently regarding joint projects between the local community college and the city to build and operate a public library. Individuals who responded to the question gave some good examples of this type of facility/partnership.
http://bit.ly/fJJiyr
Additionally, there was a nominee from North Port, Florida for ICMA’s Community Partnership Award in 2010 that constructed a family service center that not only contains the city’s Social Services division, but 12 other non-profit agencies. 
http://bit.ly/e87DPy
I hope that helps,
Amanda Dodge
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
202-962-3699
adodge@icma.org

answers.author: Richard Tripp
answers.text:
Thomas, we have completed a number of such projects.
These projects have been for local governments, school districts, public saftey organizations etc.
You can view these projects at www.msaarch.com
Richard Tripp AIA
MSA 
513-241-5666

author: Thomas Farnsworth
text: Do you have a model or success story you can share for a Task Force studying the pros cons of sharing a multipurpose facility by local governments or non-profit agencies?
title: Inter-Agency Cooperation - Public Facilities
